summary: The Preventive Home Visit Act amends Title XVIII of the Social Security Act to provide Medicare coverage for preventive home visits. These visits, conducted by qualified professionals, assess an individual's home environment, identify health risks, and provide referrals for interventions to improve physical function, reduce falls risk, and enhance nutrition. The bill defines preventive home visits, outlines payment mechanisms, and specifies a frequency limitation. The amendments are slated to take effect January 1, 2027.
